profile.name: Sai Siri Tammineni
profile.tagline: Building crisp, human-centered interfaces with reliable backends.
profile.summary: Welcome, and thanks for visiting! I’m Sai Siri Tammineni, a Software Engineer passionate about full-stack development, AI systems, and building software that creates real impact.
profile.availability: Open to select freelance and full-time roles

experience.company: Texas A&M University, Corpus Christi | International Student Programs & Services (ISPS)
experience.role: Software Development & Digital Systems Research Assistant
experience.summary: This role centered on internal systems that had to be correct, traceable, and resilient under policy and compliance constraints. The work shaped how I think about data lifecycles, auditability, and designing automation that people can trust.
bullets: Built and maintained internal web tools that handled sensitive records with clear validation paths.
Automated steps in compliance-oriented workflows to reduce manual handling and error risk.
Implemented backend logic and data checks to keep records consistent over time.
Improved reliability by making failure states visible and recoverable.
The focus on traceability influenced how I design AI-assisted workflows later.

experience.company: Texas A&M University, Corpus Christi | Marketing & Communications
experience.summary: This role was about keeping digital content systems stable and usable while supporting time-sensitive updates. The constraints were practical: reliable publishing, accessible pages, and predictable performance under real traffic.
bullets: Shipped frontend changes that prioritized clarity, accessibility, and consistent layout behavior.
Built repeatable content pipelines that reduced manual edits and publishing errors.
Kept workflows predictable so updates could move quickly without breaking pages.
The experience reinforced a discipline of clean UI boundaries and minimal complexity.

experience.summary: This role exposed me to production-oriented systems where stability and observability matter as much as new features. It reinforced the value of clean interfaces, defensive data handling, and release hygiene.
bullets: Worked on backend services and APIs that integrated with existing enterprise systems.
Touched databases and deployment workflows where rollback and monitoring were critical.
Gained exposure to CI/CD practices and operational readiness checks.
The production focus shaped my approach to performance and failure isolation.

projects.name: CryptoStream
projects.summary: CryptoStream is a real-time cryptocurrency price streaming platform that captures live tick updates directly from TradingView’s BINANCE exchange pages using Playwright. Instead of relying on rate-limited public APIs, it observes DOM price transitions in a live browser session to replicate the exact updates traders see. A Node.js + TypeScript backend streams normalized price events via ConnectRPC to a Next.js frontend, enabling push-based, low-latency rendering without polling. The system is designed for clean separation of acquisition, streaming, and UI, with controlled browser reuse and per-ticker isolation for reliability and scalability.

projects.name: EmotiveChat
projects.summary: EmotiveChat is a BERT-based multi-class emotion classifier integrated into a chatbot to enable tone-aware, context-adaptive responses. Fine-tuned on the ISEAR dataset using bert-base-uncased and trained in PyTorch, the model leverages bidirectional attention to better distinguish semantically similar emotions (e.g., guilt vs. shame). Evaluated with macro F1-score to account for class imbalance, it delivers strong performance while acknowledging nuanced overlap between classes. Integrated into a Flask backend, real-time predictions guide response tone without positioning outputs as diagnostic.

projects.name: DataPulse AI
projects.summary: DataPulse AI is a Python-based incident analysis platform that automates log ingestion, normalization, clustering, and AI-assisted summarization to reduce manual triage during production incidents. It standardizes heterogeneous logs into a common schema, enriches them with contextual metadata, and groups related events to surface high-signal clusters. An AI model generates concise, evidence-linked summaries, combining deterministic data processing with controlled AI reasoning to deliver actionable, transparent insights.

about.summary:
I am a software engineer specializing in full-stack development, AI-integrated systems, and Python automation. My work focuses on building reliable, production-ready applications that combine clean architecture with intelligent features.

I enjoy designing systems end to end — from API design and database modeling to frontend implementation and deployment workflows. My approach emphasizes maintainability, observability, and real-world usability rather than experimental prototypes.
